org.hypergraphdb.viewer.util.cytoscape.task
Interface TaskMonitor

All Known Implementing Classes:
JTask
public interface TaskMonitor

Interface for monitoring the progress of a task.

Method Detail

setPercentCompleted

void setPercentCompleted(int percent)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException,
                                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This is a hook for a child process to report to its parent application what percentage of a task it has completed.

Typically, the parent application implements this method and offers it as a hook to its child process. A child process may make an educated guess as to what percentage of the task it has completed; repeated calls to this method do not guarantee ascending values of percent.

The parent application will use this information submitted by the child process to present a percent completed progress bar to a user, for example. Some tasks may choose to go from 0 to 100 on all subtasks which are executed in order by a task. For example, 

 m_taskMonitor.setPercentCompleted(0);
 m_taskMonitor.setStatus("fetching URL");
 // fetch URL
 m_taskMonitor.setPercentCompleted(100);
 m_taskMonitor.setPercentCompleted(0);
 m_taskMonitor.setStatus("parsing webpage");
 // parse webpage
 m_taskMonitor.setPercentCompleted(100);

This method should not block; it should return quickly.

Parameters:
percent - a value between 0 and 100 representing what [guessed] percentage of a task has completed; or -1 to indicate that a task is indeterminate.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - TaskMonitor can only be be called from the thread that invokes the task run().
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
if percent is not in the interval [-1, 100].

setEstimatedTimeRemaining

void setEstimatedTimeRemaining(long time)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException
This is a hook for a child process to report to its parent application estimated time until task completion.

This hook is primarily useful for very long-running processes. For example, if a user initiates 100 queries to a database, it may be useful to report back to the user that the task will not complete for 5 minutes and 25 seconds.

Tasks are not required to report estimated time remaining. If a task does not to report this value, or has no way of determining it, the task can safely choose not to invoke this method.

Parameters:
time - estimated time until task completion, in milliseconds.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - TaskMonitor can only be be called from the thread that invokes the task run().

setException

void setException(java.lang.Throwable t,
                  java.lang.String userErrorMessage)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException
Indicates to a parent application that a task has encountered an error while processing.

This method provides a convenient mechanism for reporting errors back to the end-user.

This method is used to report non-recoverable fatal errors, and must be called at the very end of a run() method (for example, in a catch block).

Parameters:
t - an exception that occurred while processing of the task.
userErrorMessage - a user-presentable error message describing the nature of the exception; may be null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - TaskMonitor can only be be called from the thread that invokes the task run().

setStatus

void setStatus(java.lang.String message)
               throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException,
                      java.lang.NullPointerException
This is a hook for a child process to report to its parent application a short one-line text description (not exceeding, say, 60 characters, even though that is not enforced) of the current phase of processing.

For example, a spring embedded layout algorithm on a graph, if it were a task, could report a status string such as "Calculating node distances" and could later report a status string as "Calculating partial derivatives".

Parameters:
message - a non-null status message that describes the current state of a task's processing; use the empty string ("") to unset the current status message.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if message is null.
java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - TaskMonitor can only be be called from the thread that invokes the task run().
